drupalNodeEvent.title: Settler Nativization in the Inner Eurasian Borderlands of the Qing and Russian Empires

field_organizers.processed: Harvard University Fairbank Center For Chinese Studies

field_description.processed: This talk explores the similarity and difference between the nativization of Han Chinese and Russian settlers and the responses of the states. This paper argues that the difference of autonomy and local authority of native peoples in both empires should contribute to the consequence of settler nativization in the Qing and Russian empires.
